review: It's okay.  They advertise that it's a stick you plug into your HMDI plug but they don't tell you, nor show, that there is also a cumbersome power cord that sticks out of the fire stick and then you have to find yet another power outlet to plug it into and try to hide yet another chord with the maze of chords and wire behind your TV.  Also, the Fire Stick dominates my sound system that is hooked up to my TV in that as soon as I turn on my TV the Fire Stick powers up and takes over even if I don't want to watch Fire stick TV.  So then I have to use my TV remote to change the input in order to watch regular TV.  The third annoying thing is the DAMN remote.  No directions on how to open it to put the batteries in.  You have to go on-line to look for directions or a video to figure it out.  Even Amazon (on their video) tells you to use a sharp knife in order to coax the DAMN thing open.  POORLY DESIGNED remote if that's what it takes to open the DAMN thing!!!!!
author: Frederick DeNorscia
